comment: Bubble seems to be playing "now you see me, now you don't" with me. Or in plain English, the bubble is disappearing and then reappearing again and again and again again... Edit: I very well know those options. Clarification, the bubble "flickers" rapidly when it should be showing steady (as in when I am typing)!

1. if your clipboard history is empty. bubble won't show.
2. if you select "Only show when typing", bubble will only show when typing.

title: A great app!
comment: A definitely fine, smoothly working app with sharp design. While I myself still prefer just using a keyboard with a clipboard history button (quick pasting of multiple items from the clipboard is a killer feature), I'd still call Clip Stack the second best option, easily.

title: 貌似是国人开发的，要强烈支持😘
comment: It folliws the Material Design everywhere,so i love this!
Very very beautiful
An app full of surprises.
Love it

An excellent lightweight clipboard manager which uses minimal system resources. I especially like the floating bubble which means no swapping between apps to find and insert the clips, unlike the others I tried. I use the standard android keyboard to insert prepared clips (text expanding) from user dictionary so the two work together very well. The only feature I would really like to see added is a way to reorder the clips.

title: Pretty Awesome
comment: It does what it says perfectly, and it's open source. What's not to love?

title: Awesome
comment: Very helpful app. Multi window only supports certain apps and even with root it is still limited. I can save practically everything with this app!

title: Par excellence
comment: What more can be said? All claims/statements made in the app's description are entirely accurate. What's more, it's aesthetically bliss and a sheer wondrous treat to use. Keep up the magnificent development, you've already more-than proved yourself :D

I had been using Copy Bubble but found it lacking a few features. This app delivers those features as well as a couple I hadn't even thought of. I hope someone at Google offers you a wheelbarrow full of money and integrates this app into all future versions of Android.
Useful and much needed.

title: Excellent app! There's an issue with screen rotation in edit mode though.
comment: The notification works well, and the UI is aesthetically pleasing. The main problem I have is that in edit mode, all of the new text you've typed disappears upon screen rotation. This is a shame because the app would otherwise be handy for composing text for websites w bad text entry boxes. I'd also love to see the ability to delete entries direct from the notification! Another dislike is that hitting a clipboard entry on the pop-up does not take you straight into edit mode like it does in the app itself.

title: Has potential
comment: I downloaded the app last night. When I tried to connect my bluetooth earbuds it would not connect. I tried powering down my devices and taking the battery out of my phone ...nothing helped. Then I uninstalled the app, powered down my devices, took the battery out my phone, and powered on my phone and everything is back to normal after 1 hr of trying to resolve the issue.
I'm sorry to hear that. But it may be your phone's bug because clip stack doesn't have any permission about bluetooth.

title: KeePass concern.
comment: Keepass copies the username and password to the clipboard, where it is then deleted after a few seconds. But Clipstack copies the clipboard thus providing a security problem. Clipstack can't do anything about it and that's fine but I wish there was a toggle in the notification so I can easily turn it on and off, still being able to copy text from it though. Unfortunately there is no notification unless the service is on, making it tedious to switch it on and off. Still, a very well designed and useful app.
I tried lastpass. It seems that it didn't modify the clipboard. Could you please tell me which keepass app are you using?

title: Okay, but needs more
comment: 3 stars compared to the other similar utility that I'm using (which I gave 4). If you get to synching across devices (which it can do and is infinitely useful.) before they get to sharing clips (which you can do) that'll go to 5 stars. 😉

Many people usually copy their password or some other sensitive strings to clipboard. So I think a clipboard manager app should not have any permissions about network connecting.
I strongly recommend PushBullet if you really want to sync clipboard across platforms & devices. 😉
